amendment.description: Amendment sought to reduce the authorization for the Ground Based Strategic Deterrent program by $17.93 million, and to increase the authorization for Air Force procurement of Large Aircraft Infrared Countermeasures by a similar amount.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 3 printed in Part B of House Report 114-569 to reduce the authorization for the Ground Based Strategic Deterrent program by $17.93 million, the amount identified by the Government Accountability Office as in excess of program need for Fiscal Year 2016 and to increase the authorization for Air Force procurement of Large Aircraft Infrared Countermeasures by $17.93 million to address an unfunded requirement identified by the Air Force.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Garamendi amendment (A004) Failed by voice vote.

action.text: House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A004) offered by Mr. Garamendi.
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Garamendi amendment (A004) Failed by voice vote.
Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
